questions.question: 彼はまるで何でも知っている（＿）話す。
questions.hint:
まるでまるで (marude) - as if
知しっている (shitte iru) - to know
話はなす (hanasu) - to speak

explanation.correct:
Correct! みたいに (like, as if)

  • みたいにみたいに (mitai ni): to talk as if knowing everything
  • ところでところで (tokoro de): by the way
  • わけでわけで (wake de): because of that reason
  • うちにうちに (uchi ni): while doing something

Full Sentence Meaning: He talks as if he knows everything.
explanation.incorrect:
Incorrect! The correct answer is 1. みたいに (mitai ni).

  • ところでところで (tokoro de): by the way
  • わけでわけで (wake de): because of that reason
  • うちにうちに (uchi ni): while doing something

Meaning: He talks as if he knows everything.

questions.question: 彼は結果を出すために、毎日努力を（＿）。
questions.hint:
結果けっか (kekka) - result
努力どりょく (doryoku) - effort

explanation.correct:
Correct! 重かさねた (kasaneta) - accumulated

  • 治した - healed or fixed
  • 削った - shaved or reduced
  • 伸ばした - extended or stretched

Full Sentence Meaning: He put in continuous effort every day to get results.
explanation.incorrect:
Incorrect! The correct answer is 1. 重ねた (kasaneta).

  • 治した - to heal or fix
  • 削った - to reduce
  • 伸ばした - to extend

Meaning: He continuously accumulated efforts to achieve results.

questions.question: あの二人は顔を合わせるたびに（＿）。
questions.hint:
顔かおを合あわせる (kao o awaseru) - to meet
たびたびに - every time

explanation.correct:
Correct! 火花ひばなを散ちらす (hibana o chirasu) - to clash fiercely

  • 手を抜く - to cut corners
  • 顔を潰す - to disgrace someone
  • 足を引っ張る - to drag someone down

Full Sentence Meaning: Every time those two meet, they fiercely clash.
explanation.incorrect:
Incorrect! The correct answer is 1. 火花を散らす (hibana o chirasu).

  • 手を抜く - to slack off
  • 顔を潰す - to ruin someone's reputation
  • 足を引っ張る - to hold someone back

Meaning: Every time those two meet, sparks fly between them.

questions.question: 何度も同じミスをして、彼の信頼を（＿）。
questions.hint:
信頼しんらい (shinrai) - trust
何度なんども - many times

explanation.correct:
Correct! 失うしなった (ushinatta) - lost

  • 上げた - raised
  • 拾った - picked up
  • 借りた - borrowed

Full Sentence Meaning: He lost their trust by repeating the same mistake many times.
explanation.incorrect:
Incorrect! The correct answer is 1. 失った (ushinatta).

  • 上げた - raised
  • 拾った - picked up
  • 借りた - borrowed

Meaning: He repeatedly made mistakes and lost their trust.

questions.question: 彼女の話はいつも（＿）が合っておもしろい。

questions.question: あの選手はついに限界を（＿）。

questions.question: あの人はお金のことになると、（＿）を持たない。
questions.hint: 執着しゅうちゃく (shuuchaku) - attachment, obsession

explanation.correct:
Correct! 執着しゅうちゃく (shuuchaku) - obsession/attachment

Incorrect! The correct answer is 1. 執着 (shuuchaku).

questions.question: 彼はいつも口だけで、行動が（＿）。
questions.hint:
行動こうどう (koudou) - action
伴ともなわない (tomowanai) - not accompanied

explanation.correct:
Correct! 伴ともなわない (tomowanai) - not accompanied

  • 過ぎない - nothing more than
  • 異ならない - not different
  • 足らない - not enough

Full Sentence Meaning: He always talks but never takes action.
explanation.incorrect:
Incorrect! The correct answer is 1. 伴わない (tomowanai).

  • 過ぎない - merely
  • 異ならない - not different
  • 足らない - insufficient

Meaning: He only talks and never follows through with action.
